data.event: The 2000 U.S. census counted 35,073 residents in the 15.24-square-mile Chatsworth neighborhoodâ€”or 2,301 people per square mile, among the lowest population densities for both the city and the county.
In 2008, the city estimated that the population had increased to 37,102.

event.title: 2000 the median age for residents was 40, considered

data.event: In 2000 the median age for residents was 40, considered old for city and county neighborhoods; the percentages of residents aged 35 and older were among the county's highest.
